remarks: If a proposition is false, then implying it is equivalent to being false. One of four theorems that can be used to simplify an implication ` ( ph -> ps ) ` , the other ones being ~ ax-1 (true consequent), ~ pm2.21 (false antecedent), ~ pm5.5 (true antecedent).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Apr-2019.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 26-May-2019.)
